DOCNAME: SEGI AND OTHERS & GESTORAS PRO-AMNISTIA AND OTHERS v. 15 STATES OF THE EUROPEAN UNION
TEXT: The applicants are

– in the case of application no . CARDINAL : PERSON , an association based in GPE ( GPE ) and GPE ( GPE ) , and the association ’s CARDINAL spokespersons , PERSON , a NORP national , member of the NORP autonomous parliament , who lives in PERSON ( Guipuzcoa province ) , and Mr PERSON , a NORP national living in PERSON ( département of ORG ) ;

– in the case of application no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL : PERSON , an association based in PERSON ( Guipuzcoa province ) , and the association ’s CARDINAL spokespersons , Mr PERSON , a NORP national , currently detained in PERSON remand prison ( département of GPE ) , and Mr PERSON , a NORP national , currently a prisoner in Soto del Real Prison ( GPE ) .
The applicants were represented before the ORG by Mr D. Rouget , a lawyer practising in GPE .

( a ) DATE Segi ( meaning “ Continue ” ) was set up on DATE . At the constituent general meeting on that date it appointed as its spokespersons PERSON and Mr PERSON . They are authorised to act on the association ’s behalf and to represent it .

PERSON describes itself as the movement of NORP youth . It has members in all the provinces of the NORP lands in GPE and in GPE . Its aims are to campaign on youth issues and protect the NORP identity , NORP culture and the NORP language . It asserts that it works through democratic channels to ensure respect for fundamental rights , both collective and individual . It campaigns for the right to self - determination and a negotiated political solution to the NORP conflict . It fights for a fairer , more mutually supportive society by combating inequality and discrimination , racism , sexism and homophobia . It combats the oppression of youth , drug trafficking , social insecurity , poverty and violence against young people . It promotes the social , cultural and political expression of young people by organising events , rallies , festivals and concerts .

In a decision of DATE , central investigating judge no . CARDINAL at FAC in GPE ordered the suspension of the association ’s activities as a preventive measure on the ground that it was “ an integral part of the NORP terrorist organisation ORG - EKIN ” . In a decision of DATE he further ordered the detention pending trial of CARDINAL of the association ’s leaders , including the applicant PERSON , charged with terrorism - related activities punishable under LAW ; he referred to Common Position CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CFSP of ORG .
( b ) Gestoras Pro - Amnistía is a non - governmental organisation for the protection of human rights in the NORP lands , particularly those of political prisoners and exiles .
Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON have been appointed as its spokesmen .

In a decision of DATE , central investigating judge no . CARDINAL at FAC in GPE ordered the suspension of the association ’s activities as a preventive measure on the ground that it was “ an integral part of the NORP separatist organisation ORG ” . The association appealed .
Common Positions DATE
On DATE the representatives of the CARDINAL member GPE , meeting as ORG , adopted in the context of ORG ( CFSP ) the following CARDINAL common positions :

– Common Position CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CFSP “ on combating terrorism ” . This contains measures of principle to be taken by ORG and its member GPE to combat terrorism . LAW recommends that member GPE become parties as soon as possible to the international conventions and protocols relating to terrorism listed in an annex . These include ORG on the Suppression of Terrorism of DATE , which came into force on CARDINAL DATE ;
– Common Position CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CFSP “ on the application of specific measures to combat terrorism ” .
These CARDINAL common positions took effect on the date of their adoption . They were published in ORG of ORG ( OJEC ) on DATE .

Common Position CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CFSP is addressed to both ORG ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL , relating to the freezing of funds , which affects the free movement of capital , a Community matter ) and the member LAW CARDINAL , relating to police and judicial cooperation in criminal matters , which is not a question for the Community ) . Article QUANTITY states that the common position applies to “ persons , groups and entities involved in terrorist acts ” who are listed in its annex . The names of both the applicant associations appear on the annexed list . However , according to the list , they are subject to LAW
LAW provides :

“ Member GPE shall , through police and judicial cooperation in criminal matters within the framework of LAW of LAW , afford each other the widest possible assistance in preventing and combating terrorist acts . To that end they shall , with respect to enquiries and proceedings conducted by their authorities in respect of any of the persons , groups and entities listed in the ORG , fully exploit , upon request , their existing powers in accordance with acts of ORG and other international agreements , arrangements and conventions which are binding upon member GPE . ”

ORG ( ORG ) no . CARDINAL of DATE “ on specific measures directed against certain persons and entities with a view to combating terrorism ” implemented ORG and CARDINAL of the common position as regards their provisions on the freezing of funds .

The provisions concerning a Common Foreign and Security Policy ( CFSP ) , designated as the second pillar of ORG , were introduced by LAW DATE , known as LAW ( “ LAW ” ) . They were modified on DATE when the member PERSON adopted LAW , which came into force on DATE . The CFSP is therefore at present provided for in Title V of LAW .

Under the CFSP the ORG , which consists of a representative of each member ORG at ministerial level , authorised to commit the government of that member ORG ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the LAW establishing ORG ) , takes various types of decision , particularly joint actions ( LAW ) and common positions ( LAW ) . These common positions define the approach of the ORG to a particular matter of a geographical or thematic nature . Member GPE must ensure that their national policies conform to the common positions .

LAW provides that decisions under the CFSP are to be taken by the representatives of the member GPE , either unanimously , under paragraph CARDINAL , or by a qualified majority , under paragraph CARDINAL . Where a member ORG declares that , for important and stated reasons of national policy , it intends to oppose the adoption of a decision to be taken by a qualified majority , no vote is taken . The ORG , acting by a qualified majority , may request that the matter be referred to ORG , for decision by unanimous vote .
In both cases , whether unanimity or qualified majority , the opposition of a single ORG prevents the taking of a decision under the CFSP .

CFSP decisions are therefore intergovernmental in nature . By taking part in their preparation and adoption each ORG engages its responsibility . That responsibility is assumed jointly by the GPE when they adopt a CFSP decision .

Police and judicial cooperation in criminal matters ( known as ORG and ORG – “ JHA ” or the third pillar ) is now provided for by LAW of LAW , as modified by LAW . In the context of such cooperation the ORG can take common positions and promote cooperation contributing to the pursuit of the objectives of the Union , using the appropriate form and procedures .
The Union ’s actions in the field of the CFSP and JHA have a strongly intergovernmental character . The instruments through which the CFSP is mediated are joint actions and common positions .

Common positions are intended to strengthen and improve the coordination of cooperation between the member GPE , which are supposed to apply and defend them . Adopted by ORG , they are ORG acts which require member GPE to conduct national policies consistent with the approach laid down by the ORG in a particular field . They are therefore not directly applicable , as such , in the member GPE , and their implementation requires the adoption by each member ORG of concrete domestic provisions in the appropriate legal form .

Decisions taken by the ORG representatives under the CFSP are not subject to judicial review within ORG , since by virtue of LAW is not empowered to review the lawfulness of decisions taken in the field of the CFSP .
A ORG and ORG issue may not be referred to ORG except in the form of a request for a preliminary ruling under the conditions laid down in LAW .
